intro: Solenotheca, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, spiny bracts that surround the small yellow flowers, giving it a unique and often ornamental appearance. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Solenotheca species are often used in horticulture for their decorative value and ability to thrive in poor soils. Their life cycle includes a period of dormancy, which helps them survive in fluctuating environmental conditions.
